titleStmt.title: Oxford, Bodleian Library, Laud Misc. MS 108

respStmt.resp: Transcribed from the digital images and encoded by
respStmt.name: Sharon K. Goetz
Nick Hamilton
Scott Kleinman
Andrea Lankin
Marisa Libbon

msContents.summary: The manuscript contents are catalogued in DIMEV entry http://www.dimev.net/Records.php?MSS=BodLauMis108. All items belong to the LAEME literary category. A full description can be found in the Manuscripts of the West Midlands at http://www.hrionline.ac.uk/mwm/browse?type=ms&id=118.

msItem.title: St. Francis of Assisi
msItem.note: According to Horstmann, this vita is based on the Vita sanctus Franciscus by Saint Bonaventure in Act. SS. Boll. Oct. 4 p. 742 ff.

St. Edmund of Abingdon (Edme of Abingdon)

msItem.title: Allas deceyte, þat in truste ys nowe

msItem.title: Be þou nou&yogh;t to bolde to blame
Better ys to suffre and fortune abide
He þe wise and wel i tau&yogh;t

handNote.p: The first part of the manuscript, ff. 1r-200r written in the last quarter of the thirteenth century.
The second part of the manuscript, ff. 200v-203v written in the last quarter of the thirteenth century.
The third part of the manuscript, ff. 204r-228r written in the early thirteenth century.
The fourth part of the manuscript, ff. 204r-228r written in a compact textura hand of the early thirteenth century.

The fifth part of the manuscript, ff. 228v-237v written in the late fourteenth century in a script of the same type and date (Anglicana) as that of Cambridge, Magdalene College, Pepys, MS 2498 and London, British Library, Laud Misc. MS 622.
In the sixth part of the manuscript, the top of f. 238 is in a hand of the fifteenth century.
In the sixth part of the manuscript, the verses on the rest of f. 238 are also in a hand of the fifteenth century.
On one flyleaf, f. iii recto, a fourteenth-century hand writes a prayer in Latin.

On one flyleaf, f. iii recto, a fifteenth-century hand has written a contents list, seemingly for a different manuscript, which has been inserted within the leaf. Note: another hand (different style of final s, for example) has traced over the first few lines; whether the tracing hand has contributed writing of its own is not known.

origin.p: ff. 1-198r are written in a W Oxon dialect from around the last quarter of the thirteenth century.
ff. 204r-219v are written in a W Norfolk dialect from around c. 1300.
ff. 219v-228r are written in a W Norfolk dialect with a substratum from SE Surrey, SW Kent, or N Suffolk, from around c. 1300.
ff. 228v-237v were written around the late fourteenth century.
The verses on f. 238 were written in the fifteenth century.

provenance.p: The manuscript was owned by Henry Perveys around 1450-1475.
The manuscript was owned by William Laud in 1633.

history.acquisition: The manuscript was donated to the Bodleian Library by William Laud in 1635.

bibl.ref: All items belong to the LAEME literary category.

revisionDesc.change: Modified multiple sections based on revisions to schema.
Relocated in laudmisc108_sk-corrSKG.xml teiHeader subsections to enable validation; converted some character entities.
Further modifications to enable validation. File reconciled with laudmisc108_sk-corrSKG.xml, except for conversion of entities.
References to project staff changed to IDs with the bio prefix.
Complete transcription of lines 1-190 added. Some xml:ids updated. Many comments added to highlight issues for further discussion.
